description: Although spear throwing contraptions were used throughout the entire world, this design in particular hails from Mesoamericas.  It was especially popular among Peruvian natives, despite the Nahuatl origin of the name.  It is essentially a carved piece of wooden shaft with a hollowed space to place the projectile of the same name.  It'll also do well as a melee weapon in a pinch.
//2: Significantly worse accuracy than a bow. See 'Comparing Atlatls and Bows: Accuracy and Learning Curve' by John C Whittaker
